result.execSummary:
The defendant Dayton T. Boris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs.  Pay during the course of probation. 
Pay blood test fee of $50.00.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Mental Health Evaluation and comply with follow-up treatment as indicated.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Pay balances of costs within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today.
Huber privileges for work, alcohol & other abuse counseling and treatment are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Dayton T. Boris in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF477, 14CM495

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Files Victim letters with the Court. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Has reviewed the letters as well. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM495 both counts - NO CONTEST
14CF477 Counts 2, 3 & 5 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CM395 both counts and 14CF477 Counts 2, 3 & 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF477 Counts 1, 4 & 6 are dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CM495 both counts
Sentence withheld on each.
Probation 24 months, concurrent to each other:
Pay costs.  Pay during course of probation.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain employment. 

14CF477 on each counts 2 ,3 & 5 -
Sentence withheld
Concurrent 24 months probation concurrent with 14CM495. 
Pay costs.  Pay during course of probation. 
Mental health evaluation and comply with follow-up treatment as indicated. 
Domestic abuse alternative program. 
Blood test fee of $50.00. 

Bonds to be applied to the costs with any balance returned to the poster.
